PAD_JaheiraPointsToOrbs.synopsis: Jaheira is being coy (or difficult, you decide) about the puzzle behind her orbs. She'll draw attention to them, but not give you the answer outright.
PAD_JaheiraPointsToOrbs.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's Basement- Walk down by the lake, near the glowing green orb.

AD_GiantSkeletonCombatAD001.synopsis: The giant skeleton that Nina summons in the graveyard. Implied to be her brother in particular, as a sick twisted play by Myrkul.

PAD_MinscAttackedFamily.synopsis: If Minsc is made to attack Jaheira's family, and there are no players around for him to get angry at, he will instead AD and offstage.

AD_JordAndRion.synopsis: AD back and forth between Jaheira's Son and Daughter when they're unaware that Jaheira is returning
AD_JordAndRion.how_to_trigger: - Go into Jaheira's house without Jaheira- Watch and wait

PAD_JaheiraGrove.synopsis: Jaheira reaction - Tied to LOW_JaheirasHouse_PAD_JaheiraReactions, this is Jaheira reacting to seeing her druid grove.
PAD_JaheiraGrove.how_to_trigger: - Enter Jaheira's house- Go down towards her grove, shouldBookmark for the house: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

EldestDaughter.synopsis: Conversation with Jaheira's Daughter if your party doesn't have Jaheira with you/after Jaheira has spoken to her. Her children should combo to give the player just enough information to hang themselves with Re: why Jaheira's children are of vastly different ages (and in theory races)
EldestDaughter.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's House- Talk to Jaheira's Daughterlarian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

MessengerRat001.synopsis: One of four messenger rats being trained in Jaheira's basement. The rats themselves are relatively new, excitable, and often get the details of their intel wrong. Each hints at a different event around the city, getting it just a little bit off.
MessengerRat001.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's Basement- Talk to the ratsJaheira Basement Bookmark: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheiraBasement&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-1537.007690;17.081484;1028.876221&camTarget=-1537.406860;16.317995;1028.368530

MinscSawFamilyAttacked.synopsis: If Minsc is in your party, in range, and you attack Jaheira's family like the monster you are. Only fires if Jaheira isn't also there, or she comments instead.

YoungestDaughter.synopsis: Jaheira's youngest daughter is practicing with a sword outside the front door - she's demanding, inquisitive and insistent in a way you would imagine a younger Jaheira might have been.The kids are there to give little prompts to how to find the note that allows them to persuade the adult kids to stay. This one points the player to the hidden basement, and should give a hint that Harpers come and go.
YoungestDaughter.how_to_trigger: - Approach Jaheira's house from the front (near the bookmark)- Speak to the little girl infront of the entranceBookmark for the house: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

PostmasterBadger.synopsis: A Postmaster Badger living in Jaheira's basement and tending to all of her scurrying about messenger rats while she's away or occupied. And in this case while she's here and too busy to, also. All just handwavey one liners to give a tiny bit of context to what's happening down here - keeping the budget low for cinematic's sake, but we want to convey somehow that there is a little force of rats Jaheira has trained as messengers.
PostmasterBadger.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's Basement- Talk to the Postmaster BadgerJaheira Basement Bookmark: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheiraBasement&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-1537.007690;17.081484;1028.876221&camTarget=-1537.406860;16.317995;1028.368530

MessengerRat003.synopsis: One of four messenger rats being trained in Jaheira's basement. The rats themselves are there for flavour and need to remain a single voiceline only each, but could do with conveying why Jaheira has multiple rats and a badger in her basement - IE for delivering messages around Baldur's Gate.
MessengerRat003.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's Basement- Talk to the ratsJaheira Basement Bookmark: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheiraBasement&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-1537.007690;17.081484;1028.876221&camTarget=-1537.406860;16.317995;1028.368530

AD_EldestSonCombatAD001.synopsis: One of Jaheira's eldest son's attack lines

AD_GossipAboutBooks.synopsis: Jaheira's eldest son is talking to the middle daughter about the books and scrolls in her study. Just casual chitchat to explain why she's there.

AD_GiantSkeletonCombatAD002.synopsis: The giant skeleton that Nina summons in the graveyard. Implied to be her brother in particular, as a sick twisted play by Myrkul.

PAD_EnteredSecretRoom.synopsis: Jaheira responds to the player picking up an item - if not expressly told they can.
PAD_EnteredSecretRoom.how_to_trigger: - Go into Jaheira's basement- Go behind the secret bookcase- Start looting infront of her, after she hasn't said you can

AD_Attacked_EldestDaughter.synopsis: AD for any of Jaheira's family getting attacked - They run away immediately and this is mainly to make it clear what they're doing, since they're not necessarily following usual systemic patterns.

AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD003.synopsis: One of Jaheira's eldest daughter's (Rion) attack lines

PAD_MinscSawWeapons.synopsis: AD specifically for Minsc when you open the chest and see both of the weapons in Jaheira's basement
PAD_MinscSawWeapons.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's Basement- Finish the elemental puzzle- Open the treasure chest

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay.synopsis: Jaheira's eldest is giving the youngest daughter  tips and tricks in her training session before the mannequin. Figure it'd be a nice quick bonding moment, and give us the implication that they're far more trained than they let on.

MiddleDaughter.synopsis: Jaheira's granddaughter that is inside - she's earnest and friendly.Her clue that she supplies the player with is to do with how to access Jaheira's hidden items in the basement - that puzzle is 4 orbs you hit with different spells to produce little platforms and jump across to get to her personal gear.
MiddleDaughter.how_to_trigger: - Inside the house, there's a small girl- Speak to the girl thereBookmark for the house: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

HalflingSquatter.synopsis: A halfling man who was helped by Jaheira's family years back and has been a firm ally to them - he appears if you have either ignored Jaheira's quest, killed her, booted her from her party, attacked her family, or whatnot. He's a kindly and straightforward man, only here because he heard difficulties befell them, so he came here to house sit and do some good in their absence.

AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD001.synopsis: One of Jaheira's eldest daughter's (Rion) attack lines

AD_Attacked_YoungestSon.synopsis: AD for any of Jaheira's family getting attacked - They run away immediately and this is mainly to make it clear what they're doing, since they're not necessarily following usual systemic patterns.

AD_FigAndRion.synopsis: AD back and forth between Jaheira's eldest daughter and her youngest ward, Fig. Fig saw Jaheira approaching and ran inside - this conversation plays back and forth while they wait for the player to enter.
AD_FigAndRion.how_to_trigger: - Go into Jaheira's house with Jaheira- Get noticed by Fig, the girl near the entrance- Watch and wait

PAD_FoundScroll.synopsis: Player picks up Jaheira's scroll - it describes the Timeless Body rite, a ritual in which druids can dramatically slow their aging. It will open an InParty branch to confront Jaheira about whether she plans to use it.
PAD_FoundScroll.how_to_trigger: Go to Jaheira's basementFind a scroll hidden under a book on the tableBookmark - larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheiraBasement&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-1537.007690;17.081484;1028.876221&camTarget=-1537.406860;16.317995;1028.368530

AD_ElementalOrbArcana.synopsis: Narrator AD for passing an arcana check when investigating the orbs in Jaheira's Basement
AD_ElementalOrbArcana.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's House- Go to the basement- Pass an arcana check on investigating them

AD_EldestSonFlowers.synopsis: Jaheira's eldest son is either a florist or a trainee druid (I haven't checked his latest and I originally stubbed him with both being possible) and goes around the house fettling with the flowers. I would find it incredibly charming if he talked to them as he tended them.

AD_Granddaughter.synopsis: AD's for Jaheira's granddaughter. Most of them are looping as she trains with a dummy, with one exception if she spots her gran.Some of the looping lines are voicebarks of Jaheira's from previous games - hint to players that this kid is related to her somehow.
AD_Granddaughter.how_to_trigger: - Go up to the front of Jaheira's House- Stand and watch her/Approach with Jaheira, depending which one(s) you need

AD_Attacked_EldestSon.synopsis: AD for any of Jaheira's family getting attacked - They run away immediately and this is mainly to make it clear what they're doing, since they're not necessarily following usual systemic patterns.

AD_Attacked_YoungestDaughter.synopsis: AD for any of Jaheira's family getting attacked - They run away immediately and this is mainly to make it clear what they're doing, since they're not necessarily following usual systemic patterns.

PAD_JaheiraGoesHostile.synopsis: Jaheira AD for when the player attacks Jaheira's family and combat has happened against them. Will also pull double duty for if the player walks her back to find them dead. Minsc has his own that is equally generic. This always ends in combat.This is specifically to capture, from what I can think about, - Moving Jaheira back into combat with her kids while fighting them- Moving her back there when the kids are dead on the floor

YoungestSon.synopsis: Jaheira's youngest son, a timid and frightened little boy who's brave on the inside but his cousins tease him because he gets scared easily, so they think he's a coward and never let him show his value. He has two purposes - The first is to give the player a clue or two towards opening Jaheira's secret room (It involves the lever just outside the room, on the wall on the roof, and using a harper pin downstairs as a key in a bookcase to open her basement)The second, and it might be a little on the nose, but his cowardly-but-brave behaviour is all a setup for Jaheira to have a sweet little moment where she can have a nice little cathartic nod to Khalid and encourage the kid, because she believes in him. I'll expand on thisAlso I've made the rolls intended to be easy since a Harper Pin has very little use and it feels a little weird to restrict players too much from just finding out where it is, but I'm well aware that him being told to look after it then immediately giving it away to a stranger feels weird so there's probably a more sensible way for him to point to it without outright betraying his task!
YoungestSon.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's House and go upstairs- Talk to the kid in the roomBookmark for the house: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD002.synopsis: One of Jaheira's eldest daughter's (Rion) attack lines

AD_EldestSonCombatAD002.synopsis: One of Jaheira's eldest son's attack lines

PAD_JaheiraReactions.synopsis: AD's for Jaheira commenting on little bits the player does in her house. Namely:- Approaches her study- Opens the secret door to her secret room- Enters said secret room- Finds Khalid's amulet
PAD_JaheiraReactions.how_to_trigger: - Enter Jaheira's house- Go into the main room, these should play Bookmark for the house: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

MessengerRat004.synopsis: One of four messenger rats being trained in Jaheira's basement. One of four messenger rats being trained in Jaheira's basement. The rats themselves are relatively new, excitable, and often get the details of their intel wrong. Each hints at a different event around the city, getting it just a little bit off.
MessengerRat004.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's Basement- Talk to the ratsJaheira Basement Bookmark: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheiraBasement&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-1537.007690;17.081484;1028.876221&camTarget=-1537.406860;16.317995;1028.368530

AD_EldestSonCombatAD003.synopsis: One of Jaheira's eldest son's attack lines

EldestSon.synopsis: Conversation with Jaheira's eldest son. Her children should combo to give the player just enough information to hang themselves with Re: why Jaheira's children are of vastly different ages (and in theory races)
EldestSon.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's house- Talk to Jaheira's Sonlarian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

PAD_MinscGoesHostile.synopsis: Minsc AD for when the player attacks Jaheira's family and combat has happened against them. Will also pull double duty for if the player walks her back to find them dead. Minsc has his own that is equally generic. This always ends in combat.This is specifically to capture, from what I can think about, - Moving Minsc back into combat with Jaheira's kids while fighting them- Moving him back there when the kids are dead on the floor

PAD_JaheiraMinscGrove.synopsis: Jaheira reaction - Tied to LOW_JaheirasHouse_PAD_JaheiraReactions, this is Jaheira and Minsc reacting to seeing her druid grove.
PAD_JaheiraMinscGrove.how_to_trigger: - Enter Jaheira's house- Go down towards her grove, shouldBookmark for the house: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

AD_GiantSkeletonCombatAD003.synopsis: The giant skeleton that Nina summons in the graveyard. Implied to be her brother in particular, as a sick twisted play by Myrkul.

AD_GossipAboutHiding.synopsis: Jaheira's eldest is giving the youngest son some encouragement and trying to get him to be at ease. He's not biologically related to Jaheira's family, but has been taken in after an unknown traumatic incident with his family.Rion's approach is not to soften her tone too much or soothe him - just to treat him like everything he's doing and feeling is normal.

MessengerRat002.synopsis: One of four messenger rats being trained in Jaheira's basement. One of four messenger rats being trained in Jaheira's basement. The rats themselves are relatively new, excitable, and often get the details of their intel wrong. Each hints at a different event around the city, getting it just a little bit off.
MessengerRat002.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's Basement- Talk to the ratsJaheira Basement Bookmark: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheiraBasement&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-1537.007690;17.081484;1028.876221&camTarget=-1537.406860;16.317995;1028.368530

JaheiraSawFamilyAttacked.synopsis: If Jaheira is in your party, in range, and you attack Jaheira's family like the monster you are. If Minsc is there, he also speaks.

PAD_JaheiraAttackedFamily.synopsis: If Jaheira is made to attack her family, and there are no players around for her to get angry at, she will instead AD and offstage. Minsc will include himself if nearby.

AD_Attacked_MiddleDaughter.synopsis: AD for any of Jaheira's family getting attacked - They run away immediately and this is mainly to make it clear what they're doing, since they're not necessarily following usual systemic patterns.

AD_HalflingSquatterIdles.synopsis: Theodore Thistlewhistle, a halfling friend of Jaheira's, is moping about her now empty house - Mostly there to tell players why the house is mostly empty. His ADs are just idles and only really serve to have him musing to himself.

PAD_JaheiraPointsToOrbs_0.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraPointsToOrbs_0.text: Have no fear, the traps aren't meant for you. But - better to stick close, eh?

AD_GiantSkeletonCombatAD001_0.speaker: Garret Dortmell
AD_GiantSkeletonCombatAD001_0.text: |I'll give you what remains of me, Lord Myrkul.|

PAD_MinscAttackedFamily_0.speaker: Minsc
PAD_MinscAttackedFamily_0.text: VILLAINY! Boo will kill me before he lets me become a tool of evil once more.

AD_JordAndRion_3.speaker: Rion
AD_JordAndRion_3.text: Where's the boy got to, Jord?

AD_JordAndRion_6.speaker: Jord
AD_JordAndRion_6.text: The boy is upstairs. The girls were a little rough in their play earlier.
AD_JordAndRion_6.context: NodeContext: Wry - emphasis on 'the boy' is in response to Rion calling the youngest child that instead of his name. 'The girls' is an echo of that stress

AD_JordAndRion_5.speaker: Rion
AD_JordAndRion_5.text: Chauntea's cheeks, I told them to give him space. That's two volunteers for dishes later, then.
AD_JordAndRion_5.context: NodeContext: Dark foreboding - the girls are in trouble

AD_JordAndRion_11.speaker: Jord
AD_JordAndRion_11.text: Telk says they shut the Church of Last Hope down.

AD_JordAndRion_10.speaker: Rion
AD_JordAndRion_10.text: And how did Telk see that, through the bottom of her drinking mug?
AD_JordAndRion_10.context: NodeContext: Snorting, derisive of this friend of the family

AD_JordAndRion_8.speaker: Jord
AD_JordAndRion_8.text: She was stone cold sober. Heard it from Mother Aramina herself - the Steel Watch said they were only 'encouraging the refugees into an unlawful gathering'.
AD_JordAndRion_8.context: NodeContext: Grim humour, passing on stories from the city to his sister

AD_JordAndRion_0.speaker: Rion
AD_JordAndRion_0.text: Aye. A warm meal and a scrap of rags to sleep on must be very encouraging. Well, the mother knows -
AD_JordAndRion_0.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic - what little the refugees were being offered was hardly reason to shut the shelter down

AD_JordAndRion_7.speaker: Jord
AD_JordAndRion_7.text: That we have space to spare if she needs it. Aye, I passed it on.
AD_JordAndRion_7.context: NodeContext: Smoothly reassuring, cutting his sister off - she doesn't need to worry, he already passed on what she was going to ask.

AD_JordAndRion_13.speaker: Rion
AD_JordAndRion_13.text: Throw some cabbage on your list for the market, Jord.

AD_JordAndRion_9.speaker: Jord
AD_JordAndRion_9.text: You know I could just grow it myself. Even a lowly apprentice can manage that much.
AD_JordAndRion_9.context: NodeContext: A little affronted - he's in training as a druid, not fully in his power yet

AD_JordAndRion_12.speaker: Rion
AD_JordAndRion_12.text: I know you can, brother. Just being careful - don't want the young ones going all weird from eating mystical greens.
AD_JordAndRion_12.context: NodeContext: Tone is 'hey, I mean no offense'

AD_JordAndRion_1.speaker: Jord
AD_JordAndRion_1.context: NodeContext: Now very affronted - his sister has implied his magically cultivated food would poison the kids

AD_JordAndRion_2.speaker: Rion
AD_JordAndRion_2.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - using the youngest of their siblings as an example of how the kids are weird. Just her name alone is argument enough.

AD_JordAndRion_4.speaker: Jord
AD_JordAndRion_4.context: NodeContext: Anger dissipating into immediate agreement - Fig IS weird

PAD_JaheiraGrove_0.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraGrove_0.text: The only patch of wilderness this city permits me. There ought to be supplies here to aid us.

EldestDaughter_0.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_0.text: Make a habit of just letting yourself into people's homes, do you?

EldestDaughter_18.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_18.text: My mother's not here, if that's who you've come to see.

EldestDaughter_26.speaker: Minsc
EldestDaughter_26.text: Eh, Rion...? We know your mother is not here. She is travelling with us.
EldestDaughter_26.context: NodeContext: Speaking up as Rion hasn't seen him yet - a little sheepish to correct her

EldestDaughter_6.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_6.text: Minsc? I don't understand - she was chasing down the cult for a lead to save you. If she's already done it...

EldestDaughter_34.speaker: Minsc
EldestDaughter_34.text: Ah, well. If Boo were to be technical, he would say that it is not Jaheira alone who saved Minsc. It was this one here.
EldestDaughter_34.context: NodeContext: Still a little sheepish, no direct gesture to player

EldestDaughter_13.speaker: Player
EldestDaughter_13.text: Wait - I know Jaheira. I've just returned to the city with her.

EldestDaughter_8.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_8.text: She's... she's alive? Who are you to her - a Harper?

EldestDaughter_7.speaker: Player
EldestDaughter_7.text: A friend. Though maybe not so close as I'd hoped - she never mentioned you.

EldestDaughter_17.speaker: Player
EldestDaughter_17.text: Allies. We fought General Ketheric Thorm together.

EldestDaughter_31.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_31.text: General...? We'd heard of the cult army heading this way - I assumed she'd died trying to stop it.

EldestDaughter_33.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_33.text: But... she's alive. EVERYONE, SHE'S ALIVE!

EldestDaughter_12.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_12.text: Bring her here. So we can kill her.

EldestDaughter_3.speaker: Player
EldestDaughter_3.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. Your mother hasn't mentioned me in any letters?

EldestDaughter_36.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_36.text: Don't be too wounded. Up until this moment, she was missing - presumed dead out in the shadowlands.

EldestDaughter_30.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_30.text: ...So you're not here to see her? Who are you, then?

EldestDaughter_2.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_2.text: It's a bold thief who would just stroll into the druid Jaheira's home. Still time to turn around and go.

EldestDaughter_10.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_10.text: I told you, my mother isn't here.

EldestDaughter_15.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_15.text: Bring Jaheira home. We are in dire need of a mother-daughter chat.

EldestDaughter_16.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_16.text: I take it you won't be coming back to us until all of this is done. So hurry up.

EldestDaughter_27.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_27.text: I hear you've been causing mother some trouble. Remember what I told you about causing mother trouble?

EldestDaughter_23.speaker: Player
EldestDaughter_23.text: There was talk of your hammer. And... Minsc's head as the anvil.

EldestDaughter_28.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_28.text: Good boy. Just remember, Fig has always wanted a hamster.

EldestDaughter_21.speaker: Player
EldestDaughter_21.text: Boo would be proud, to join such a warrior in battle!

EldestDaughter_35.speaker: Player
EldestDaughter_35.text: But Minsc would be dead. You are heard and understood, Rion.

EldestDaughter_32.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_32.text: Minsc. I... wasn't expecting to see you. If you're looking for mother, I... well. There's no easy way to say it:

EldestDaughter_25.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_25.text: She's dead. The great Jaheira finally her match, taking down General Ketheric Thorm out in the shadowlands.

EldestDaughter_14.speaker: Player
EldestDaughter_14.text: Ah... Rion? Minsc does not like to correct you, but... I think you are mistaken. Jaheira is not dead!

EldestDaughter_20.speaker: Player
EldestDaughter_20.text: Just a short time ago, she pretended to be angry at Boo for rolling around in her herb-pouch.

EldestDaughter_37.speaker: Rion
EldestDaughter_37.text: Thank you for looking out for her. Now bring her back alive - she's too old for any heroic-death nonsense.

MessengerRat001_2.speaker: Messenger Rat
MessengerRat001_2.text: I bring word of gnomes. Gnomes in the sea.

MinscSawFamilyAttacked_1.speaker: Minsc
MinscSawFamilyAttacked_1.text: You... made me do something. Minsc will not become the tool of villainy again! Pray to your tiny gods that you never see my hamster's face again.

MinscSawFamilyAttacked_2.speaker: Minsc
MinscSawFamilyAttacked_2.text: Villainy! Boo saw your crimes, and even now squeaks for your blood! But you saved Minsc - for this, you live. Unless we meet again.

YoungestDaughter_3.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_3.text: (Don't be scared, I just have to look mean.)

YoungestDaughter_8.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_8.context: NodeContext:  a soldier rattling off an update to their commander

YoungestDaughter_11.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fig runs away insideNodeContext: Just a funny, childish gasp of alarm - you've challenged the intruders at your doorstep only to realize one of them is your mother, Jaheira. You immediately run away inside to tell everyone.

YoungestDaughter_9.speaker: Jaheira
YoungestDaughter_9.text: Fine. Come in, then - you might as well meet the family.
YoungestDaughter_9.context: NodeContext: Long-suffering sigh. Player has forced your hand and so you resolve to introduce them to your family - not particularly relishing the thought, but resigned.

YoungestDaughter_19.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_19.text: Right. You look harmless enough. The commander keeps an open house, so you may pass.

YoungestDaughter_23.speaker: Player
YoungestDaughter_23.text: Wait, little girl - how do you know Minsc?

YoungestDaughter_31.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_31.text: I'm not a little girl, I'm a warrior.

YoungestDaughter_2.speaker: Minsc
YoungestDaughter_2.text: Even I could have told you - this was a silly thing to say.

YoungestDaughter_7.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_7.text: That's secret. And anyway, she's away, so Rion's in charge.

YoungestDaughter_34.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_34.text: So be nice to Rion, or I'll kick you out.

YoungestDaughter_6.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_6.text: I'm not a centipede, I'm a guard.

YoungestDaughter_20.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_20.context: NodeContext: Trying and failing to say 'stand and deliver!', one of Minsc' well-known BG lines.

YoungestDaughter_16.speaker: Player
YoungestDaughter_16.text: It is stand and deliver, little Fig. Though... I think I like yours better. You bellow like a true berserker!
YoungestDaughter_16.context: NodeContext: Amused, correcting Jaheira's youngest ward on his first line in BG1. Approving.

YoungestDaughter_27.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_27.text: Rion said she'd make you sorry you taught me that. She's inside.

YoungestDaughter_12.speaker: Player
YoungestDaughter_12.text: Ah. Well... we had best not keep her waiting. Perhaps she will have mercy on Boo.

YoungestDaughter_21.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_21.text: Commander's put me in charge. On your way, citizen.

YoungestDaughter_24.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_24.text: Move on. Commander might be away, but I keep a tidy house for her.

YoungestDaughter_25.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_25.context: NodeContext: Trying and failing to say 'stand and deliver!', one of Minsc' well-known BG lines.

YoungestDaughter_30.speaker: Minsc
YoungestDaughter_30.text: It is stand and deliver, little Fig. Though... I think I like yours better. You bellow like a true berserker!

YoungestDaughter_14.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_14.text: The commander said I only had to keep out bad ones. So you can pass.

YoungestDaughter_13.speaker: Fig
YoungestDaughter_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fig runs away inside.NodeContext: Just a funny, childish gasp of alarm - you've challenged the intruders at your doorstep only to realize one of them is your mother, Jaheira. You immediately run away inside to tell everyone.

PostmasterBadger_1.speaker: Postmaster Badger
PostmasterBadger_1.text: The archdruid's eyes and ears have fallen away in her absence. I am training new ones.

PostmasterBadger_2.speaker: Postmaster Badger
PostmasterBadger_2.text: Archdruid! It is good to have you home. The new informants are... coming along.

PostmasterBadger_3.speaker: Postmaster Badger
PostmasterBadger_3.text: If you are not meant to be here, the archdruid's traps will see to you. If you have business, be about it. If you do not... poke around, and see what happens.
PostmasterBadger_3.context: NodeContext: Unfazed by our presence, getting back to her business

MessengerRat003_0.speaker: Messenger Rat
MessengerRat003_0.text: Boss says this work makes us honorary... Harlots? Harpies? Sounds nice.
MessengerRat003_0.context: NodeContext: Failing to remember the word 'Harper'

MessengerRat003_2.speaker: Messenger Rat
MessengerRat003_2.text: Down by the Blushing Mermaid, there's a stink of something fey. Smell of arse, too, but boss doesn't care about that.

AD_EldestSonCombatAD001_0.speaker: Jord
AD_EldestSonCombatAD001_0.text: This is a safe place. OUT!
AD_EldestSonCombatAD001_0.context: NodeContext: A gentle druid finally driven to fight - he's Jaheira's son, shouting in battle

AD_GossipAboutBooks_5.speaker: Jord
AD_GossipAboutBooks_5.text: Bootprints on the tabletop. You haven't been poking around the top shelves again - have you, Jhessem?
AD_GossipAboutBooks_5.context: NodeContext: Wry, knowing - he's well aware his younger sister has been poking around Jaheira's journals. [JESS-em]

AD_GossipAboutBooks_1.speaker: Jhessem
AD_GossipAboutBooks_1.text: Of course not. Her diaries are off-limits.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_7.speaker: Jord
AD_GossipAboutBooks_7.text: And written in code too, I'm afraid.
AD_GossipAboutBooks_7.context: NodeContext: Acknowledging that he once also pilfered Jaheira's journals.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_4.speaker: Jhessem
AD_GossipAboutBooks_4.text: I know. It's not a very good code.
AD_GossipAboutBooks_4.context: NodeContext: Stated mildly. Implying she's cracked Jaheira's journals.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_10.speaker: Jord
AD_GossipAboutBooks_10.text: Well, what are we reading now? More Alaundo?

AD_GossipAboutBooks_12.speaker: Jhessem
AD_GossipAboutBooks_12.text: No. I'm looking for any histories about this Absolute.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_14.speaker: Jord
AD_GossipAboutBooks_14.text: I wouldn't bother. It's a new god - unknowable and mysterious.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_0.speaker: Jhessem
AD_GossipAboutBooks_0.text: It's just another cult. And cults are common as muck.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_3.speaker: Jord
AD_GossipAboutBooks_3.context: NodeContext: Little grunt of surprise - his sister is correct, and he's impressed.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_11.speaker: Jhessem
AD_GossipAboutBooks_11.text: That reminds me. I'm working on our family tree - I've already placed Rion. You're next.
AD_GossipAboutBooks_11.context: NodeContext: Idly distracted, speaking to her half-orc brother while browsing bookshelves

AD_GossipAboutBooks_2.speaker: Jord
AD_GossipAboutBooks_2.text: Hah. Well, I'm afraid you won't find us dangling from any of the same branches, sproutling.
AD_GossipAboutBooks_2.context: NodeContext: Wry - breaking it to her that they're not related by blood, so won't appear on the same family tree

AD_GossipAboutBooks_6.speaker: Jhessem
AD_GossipAboutBooks_6.text: So we'll graft on another. A druid should know how to do that, shouldn't he?
AD_GossipAboutBooks_6.context: NodeContext: Simple, not to be denied - still browsing shelves

AD_GossipAboutBooks_13.speaker: Jord
AD_GossipAboutBooks_13.text: I... suppose he should, at that.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_15.speaker: Jord
AD_GossipAboutBooks_15.text: Try that hand-bill on fungal poultices. We might be tending the injured here before long.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_8.speaker: Jhessem
AD_GossipAboutBooks_8.text: Perhaps you should brush up on the herb-lore yourself, Jord. Mother's vines are looking a little weedy.

AD_GossipAboutBooks_9.speaker: Jord
AD_GossipAboutBooks_9.text: Why are the quiet ones always the cruellest?

PAD_EnteredSecretRoom_0.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_EnteredSecretRoom_0.text: Oh, by all means, help yourself. I'm sure there are some mouldering socks to be ransacked, too.

AD_Attacked_EldestDaughter_0.speaker: Rion
AD_Attacked_EldestDaughter_0.text: SCATTER - you all know the drill!
AD_Attacked_EldestDaughter_0.context: NodeContext: Drill sergeant mode - someone has attacked your family home, but you've prepared for this.

AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD003_0.speaker: Rion
AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD003_0.text: My mother asked me not to make a mess - oh, well.
AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD003_0.context: NodeContext: Gruff, matter of fact - shouted in battle.

PAD_MinscSawWeapons_0.speaker: Minsc
PAD_MinscSawWeapons_0.text: Aha, Jaheira's old weapons! They look strong as ever. Minsc should know - they gave him many bruises over the years.

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_4.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_4.text: Poor dummy. Look at its arms - it just wants a hug.
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_4.context: NodeContext: Joking, faux sympathy for the dummy her youngest sister is practicing swordplay on

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_1.speaker: Fig
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_1.text: That's why it keeps losing. Dummy.
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_1.context: NodeContext: Utterly serious - disdainful of the inanimate dummy's pacificism

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_9.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_9.text: Am I supposed to pretend that sword you're swinging wasn't stolen from my room?
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_9.context: NodeContext: Wry - the youngest sister hasn't fooled her

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_12.speaker: Fig
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_12.context: NodeContext: Not breaking stride in her practice

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_0.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_0.text: Funny. Because it looks just like the one I stole from mum when I was your age.

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_10.speaker: Fig
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_10.text: When can I move on to a real sword?

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_2.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_2.text: Oh, stop sulking. I had to teach myself in secret when I started. Mum didn't want to 'force me into the same life'.
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_2.context: NodeContext: 'You don't know how good you have it'

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_13.speaker: Fig
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_13.text: When did she change her mind?

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_6.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_6.text: About the third time I knocked her on her arse.

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_14.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_14.text: Good. But you'll need to learn more than just the Harper forms.

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_7.speaker: Fig
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_7.text: Is that why they threw you out? Because you didn't like their forms?
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_7.context: NodeContext: Not meant as an insult - just the bluntness of a child

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_3.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_3.text: They didn't throw me out. I left. There was just... more to be learned elsewhere.
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_3.context: NodeContext: A little insulted - the Harpers were too limiting for her - she chose to leave

AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_11.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_11.text: No, now they threw me out.
AD_GossipAboutSwordplay_11.context: NodeContext: Shrug, acknowledging that she was thrown out of the mercenary group

MiddleDaughter_0.speaker: Jhessem
MiddleDaughter_0.context: NodeContext: Inclined head - one lady acknowledging another.

MiddleDaughter_1.speaker: Jhessem
MiddleDaughter_1.text: Greetings, saer. You have not been announced to this court, and we deign not to speak with thee.

MiddleDaughter_2.speaker: Jhessem
MiddleDaughter_2.text: Jaheira is possessed of noble taste in company. You must be a fine servant indeed.

MiddleDaughter_3.speaker: Jhessem
MiddleDaughter_3.text: You may enjoy the freedom of our manor house, so long as you behave in a way befitting nobility.

MiddleDaughter_4.speaker: Jhessem
MiddleDaughter_4.text: Serve Jaheira well now, saer - and I'll consider granting you a title in my kingdom.

HalflingSquatter_3.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_3.text: I'm sure they wouldn't mind you looking around - if you're a friend, like. They're fierce charitable folks.

HalflingSquatter_11.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_11.text: Well met, friend! Theodore Thistlewhistle, at your service.

HalflingSquatter_4.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_4.text: It gives me no great pleasure to inform you that you are in fact trespassing.

HalflingSquatter_1.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_1.text: Ah, well. If it was just myself, I surely would. But I'm watching this house on behalf of someone a sight scarier.

HalflingSquatter_18.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_18.text: This house belongs to the druid Jaheira. Well - her daughter, really. I'm watching over it for her while the family's away.

HalflingSquatter_2.speaker: Player
HalflingSquatter_2.text: This isn't your home. Jaheira's family live here.

HalflingSquatter_7.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_7.text: That they do, which is why I'm watching over it for them.

HalflingSquatter_0.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_0.text: Oh, no no. This is Jaheira's house. Well - her daughter's, these days. I'm just watching over it while she's gone.

HalflingSquatter_12.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_12.text: Least I can do - young Rion helped me out of a spot of bother some years back.

HalflingSquatter_19.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_19.text: Left the city. All I know is there was some to-do, here - fighting, people say.

HalflingSquatter_10.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_10.text: Her family can usually look after themselves well enough, so I'm not too worried for them.
HalflingSquatter_10.context: InternalNodeContext: There's a better way to imply this, but the handwave I'm going for is that Elminster showed up and tidied them up/possibly even resurrected them offscreen?

HalflingSquatter_21.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_21.text: But it must've been some sort of lunatic drove them out. Regardless, here Theodore will stay until they get back.

HalflingSquatter_17.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_17.text: Jaheira - mistress of the house - is missing. Lost out somewhere to the east, the family said.
HalflingSquatter_17.context: InternalNodeContext: Might need to revisit the flags here - This branch is specifically for Jaheira being refused twice as player feedback for their decision.

HalflingSquatter_20.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_20.text: Good kids, that lot. Hope they find her safe and sound.

HalflingSquatter_16.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_16.text: Haven't a clue. Just got a letter from Rion, and they were gone by the time I got here.

HalflingSquatter_13.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
HalflingSquatter_13.text: Well, they'll find the place just as they left it - Theodore will see to it.

AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD001_0.speaker: Rion
AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD001_0.text: Have it your way, then - you might be sorry you did!
AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD001_0.context: NodeContext: Gruff, matter of fact - shouted in battle.

AD_Attacked_YoungestSon_0.speaker: Tate
AD_Attacked_YoungestSon_0.context: NodeContext: A traumatised child. Your home has been attacked and you're running away - implied to have had the same happen to him before he was in Jaheira's care.

AD_FigAndRion_0.speaker: Rion
AD_FigAndRion_0.text: Enough, Fig. There's no point getting your hopes up. She'll be back when she's back.
AD_FigAndRion_0.context: NodeContext: Trying to let the child down gently, but not speaking to her like an idiot. She knows Fig is smart, so she's being matter of fact.

AD_FigAndRion_2.speaker: Fig
AD_FigAndRion_2.context: NodeContext: Sees right through Rion's assurances

AD_FigAndRion_1.speaker: Rion
AD_FigAndRion_1.text: I know she will. But we'll wait a little longer, if you like.
AD_FigAndRion_1.context: NodeContext: Countering Fig's accusations that she doesn't think Jaheira will return alive. Sighing, letting Fig win.

AD_FigAndRion_5.speaker: Rion
AD_FigAndRion_5.text: Are you sure? Maybe it was just a labourer hauling a shaggy grey mop.
AD_FigAndRion_5.context: NodeContext: Making a joke of it. She knows Fig's hopes are up, and is trying to soften the blow rather than outright tell her Jaheira isn't coming back.

AD_FigAndRion_3.speaker: Fig
AD_FigAndRion_3.text: Be serious, Rion. Who puts braids on a mop?
AD_FigAndRion_3.context: NodeContext: Dry. Not falling for RIon's bullshit for a minute.

AD_FigAndRion_7.speaker: Fig
AD_FigAndRion_7.text: She'll be here. Any second. Maybe she's sneaking.
AD_FigAndRion_7.context: NodeContext: Assured, not giving Rion the chance to tell her she's wrong.

AD_FigAndRion_4.speaker: Rion
AD_FigAndRion_4.text: Doubtful. We'd hear her knees cracking.

PAD_FoundScroll_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundScroll_0.text: 'Rite of the Timeless Body'. What's that about? I'd best ask Jaheira.

PAD_FoundScroll_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundScroll_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Catching the edge case of players using Jaheira picking this up, just to prompt they have a chance to talk to her.

AD_ElementalOrbArcana_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_ElementalOrbArcana_0.text: *A glowing orb, but its purpose is unclear.*

AD_ElementalOrbArcana_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_ElementalOrbArcana_1.text: *The orb casts glyphs familiar to the druid of ownership; overwhelming it with the same element can often disable the enchantment.*
AD_ElementalOrbArcana_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Trying to get two beats across - These aren't harmful to Jaheira's friends, and can be dispelled by casting the same element they are at them.

AD_EldestSonFlowers_0.speaker: Jord
AD_EldestSonFlowers_0.text: Coming along nicely there, Floki. Good, strong roots.

AD_EldestSonFlowers_1.speaker: Jord
AD_EldestSonFlowers_1.text: You three have been just guzzling the water recently. Save some for the others, all right?

AD_EldestSonFlowers_2.speaker: Jord
AD_EldestSonFlowers_2.text: Oh, come on, Ferdinand, I just trimmed you.

AD_EldestSonFlowers_3.speaker: Jord
AD_EldestSonFlowers_3.text: Those leaves are a little darker than I'd like, Felicis. Bad soil? Hm. Don't tell mother...

AD_Granddaughter_1.speaker: Fig
AD_Granddaughter_1.text: Hm. Maybe I need a hamster.

AD_Granddaughter_2.speaker: Fig
AD_Granddaughter_2.text: Stand and deliver, you - wait, it's you!

AD_Attacked_EldestSon_0.speaker: Jord
AD_Attacked_EldestSon_0.text: You know where to meet, cubs - now GO!
AD_Attacked_EldestSon_0.context: NodeContext: Shouted at younger siblings - someone has attacked your family home, but you've prepared for this.

AD_Attacked_YoungestDaughter_0.speaker: Fig
AD_Attacked_YoungestDaughter_0.text: Rion says I'm not to fight. You're lucky!
AD_Attacked_YoungestDaughter_0.context: NodeContext: Surly - we've attacked her family home, and she's following orders to run away.

PAD_JaheiraGoesHostile_0.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraGoesHostile_0.text: I was a fool to trust you, and I paid the fool's price. But I will not pay it alone.
PAD_JaheiraGoesHostile_0.context: NodeContext: barely suppressed rage - found her family killed / home destroyed - about to attack us after.

YoungestSon_0.speaker: Tate
YoungestSon_0.text: Y-you're not meant to b-be here.

YoungestSon_1.speaker: Tate
YoungestSon_1.text: Jaheira's back! Now Jhess can't boss me around any more.

YoungestSon_2.speaker: Tate
YoungestSon_2.text: You owe me a proper story. A long one!

YoungestSon_4.speaker: Tate
YoungestSon_4.text: Our m-mother wouldn't like strangers in the house. She could k-kick your behind.

AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD002_0.speaker: Rion
AD_EldestDaughterCombatAD002_0.context: NodeContext: Gruff, matter of fact - shouted in battle.

AD_EldestSonCombatAD002_0.speaker: Jord
AD_EldestSonCombatAD002_0.text: Can't let you hurt anyone. I can't!
AD_EldestSonCombatAD002_0.context: NodeContext: A gentle druid finally driven to fight - he's Jaheira's son, shouting in battle

PAD_JaheiraReactions_2.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraReactions_2.text: A gift from my husband. I've had to renew parts, over the years - but the heart remains the same as the day he gave it to me.
PAD_JaheiraReactions_2.context: InternalNodeContext: May or may not be going a bit hardcore into Odysseus's ship as a throwaway line here, but oh well.NodeContext: This is in reference to her husband Khalid, who died violently over a century previously. It came close to breaking her at the time, but now there is only fondness for the man she remembers. The gift is a spider-silk amulet with a gem at its centre, made with Khalid's own hands.

PAD_JaheiraReactions_3.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraReactions_3.text: The only patch of wilderness this city permits me. There ought to be supplies here to aid us.

PAD_JaheiraReactions_9.speaker: Minsc
PAD_JaheiraReactions_9.text: You know this place, Boo? Hmph - Minsc has never been invited.
PAD_JaheiraReactions_9.context: NodeContext: A little sore - we've discovered Jaheira's urban grove, and while Boo knows it well, Minsc does not

PAD_JaheiraReactions_4.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraReactions_4.text: This Harper pin opens more doors than most. Come down to my study and see if you can figure it out.

PAD_JaheiraReactions_5.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraReactions_5.text: Hah! I wondered if it would take you long to spot.
PAD_JaheiraReactions_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Jaheira's comment when you open up the

PAD_JaheiraReactions_8.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraReactions_8.text: Pay no mind to the those. You're probably safe so long as I am here.
PAD_JaheiraReactions_8.context: InternalNodeContext: We can change this up if it doesn't work - But the Glyphs are cast like spells so players will, in theory, be immune to the effects of them as long as Jaheira is with them.

PAD_JaheiraReactions_7.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraReactions_7.text: But if you do not trust me - take the weight from the pressure plate there.
PAD_JaheiraReactions_7.context: InternalNodeContext: It's a pressure plate being held down by a box - Lifting it from it will stop the traps.

MessengerRat004_0.speaker: Messenger Rat
MessengerRat004_0.text: There's creeps in cloaks creeping around down in the sewers.

MessengerRat004_2.speaker: Messenger Rat
MessengerRat004_2.text: That's not really news, I suppose. There's always creeps in cloaks down there.
MessengerRat004_2.context: NodeContext: Reflecting that the intel probably isn't that juicy

AD_EldestSonCombatAD003_0.speaker: Jord
AD_EldestSonCombatAD003_0.text: You're just lucky my mother isn't home.
AD_EldestSonCombatAD003_0.context: NodeContext: A gentle druid finally driven to fight - he's Jaheira's son, shouting in battle. This is delivered through gritted teeth, darkly amused

EldestSon_6.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_6.text: I'll tend the sanctuary 'til the real druid is ready to return. Make sure that happens, eh? I'm still just an apprentice.

EldestSon_7.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_7.text: Go on. The longer you take, mother dear, the more of your plants will be dead when you get back.

EldestSon_9.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_9.text: If you're here about the vines, I've cleared them off the neighbouring houses already.

EldestSon_22.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_22.text: Can't promise it'll be the last time. The druid's away for a while - I'm just her son. And apprentice too, for my sins.

EldestSon_26.speaker: Minsc
EldestSon_26.text: Aha! Jaheira has left you some tasks while she was away, Jord?

EldestSon_8.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_8.text: Minsc? She's not... away. She's gone. I am sorry.

EldestSon_1.speaker: Minsc
EldestSon_1.text: And I am confused. She is not with us at this very moment, no - but she's around the city somewhere.

EldestSon_0.speaker: Player
EldestSon_0.text: I know Jaheira. We're travelling together, in fact.

EldestSon_27.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_27.text: What? You know where mum is? Tell Rion - quickly!

EldestSon_28.speaker: Player
EldestSon_28.text: An urban grove is nothing strange. Life takes many forms, and nature is hardier than any stone walls.

EldestSon_15.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_15.text: YES! Thank you. Meet my mother when she returns - put it that way, and you might just convince her.

EldestSon_4.speaker: Player
EldestSon_4.text: Why would this place need a druid? It's a house, in the middle of the city.
EldestSon_4.context: InternalNodeContext: This isn't important, I don't know why I've leaned into azalias so much, it's clearly self indulgent. Cull away

EldestSon_25.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_25.text: You think like my mother - that's why she keeps a small grove here. To 'return nature to the unnatural'.

EldestSon_2.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_2.text: Me, I don't think nature ever left. People lay down cobbles, aye, but seeds still sprout between the cracks.

EldestSon_11.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_11.text: Oh. I... took you for a friend of hers. The druid, Jaheira?

EldestSon_24.speaker: Player
EldestSon_24.text: Jord! I think this druidry suits you - you have grown taller than Minsc!
EldestSon_24.context: NodeContext: Happy to see Jaheira's son

EldestSon_17.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_17.text: You've come back at a... sad time, ranger. Jaheira's gone.

EldestSon_5.speaker: Player
EldestSon_5.text: I am not sure why this is such sad news...? Your mother is with us! Not this very moment, no - Boo thinks she is probably shouting at a tree stump somewhere.
EldestSon_5.context: NodeContext: Quizzical - doesn't understand that Jord thinks Jaheira is dead

EldestSon_18.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_18.text: Wait - what? You know where mum is? Tell Rion - quickly!

EldestSon_14.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_14.text: Bring mum back. It won't come to blows, whatever Rion says. Probably, it won't.

EldestSon_19.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_19.text: If you need a druid, come back when my mother's returned. Could be a while, though.

EldestSon_23.speaker: Jord
EldestSon_23.context: NodeContext: Restrained excitement - we've given him excellent news, he wants us to tell his sister.

PAD_MinscGoesHostile_0.speaker: Minsc
PAD_MinscGoesHostile_0.text: You thought you could do such monstrous things, and Minsc would not know? The tadpole has tattled.
PAD_MinscGoesHostile_0.context: NodeContext: Seething rage - caught the player having killed Jaheira's family or done something similarly heinous.

PAD_JaheiraMinscGrove_0.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraMinscGrove_0.text: The only patch of wilderness this city permits me. There ought to be supplies here to aid us.

PAD_JaheiraMinscGrove_1.speaker: Minsc
PAD_JaheiraMinscGrove_1.text: You know this place, Boo? Hmph - Minsc has never been invited.
PAD_JaheiraMinscGrove_1.context: NodeContext: A little sore - we've discovered Jaheira's urban grove, and while Boo knows it well, Minsc does not

AD_GiantSkeletonCombatAD003_0.speaker: Garret Dortmell
AD_GiantSkeletonCombatAD003_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Changed the Ketheric combat AD to this - I'm trying for a vibe where it adds a bit of sad drama to it, but feel free to change it back to something a bit more simple!

AD_GossipAboutHiding_5.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutHiding_5.text: Hey. You all right up here?
AD_GossipAboutHiding_5.context: NodeContext: Mild - she's not trying to force him to come out

AD_GossipAboutHiding_0.speaker: Tate
AD_GossipAboutHiding_0.text: Yeah. I'll come down soon. Sorry.

AD_GossipAboutHiding_8.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutHiding_8.text: Don't need you to be sorry. Just checking that you're all right.
AD_GossipAboutHiding_8.context: NodeContext: Shrugging. He has no reason to apologise

AD_GossipAboutHiding_10.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutHiding_10.text: You going to eat with us today?
AD_GossipAboutHiding_10.context: NodeContext: Again, mild - it's his choice

AD_GossipAboutHiding_14.speaker: Tate
AD_GossipAboutHiding_14.text: I'm not... I'm not hungry. Really.

AD_GossipAboutHiding_1.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutHiding_1.text: Ah. Well, I could use a hand with the washing up - last time I let Fig do it, she blunted my best knife slaying 'soap-mephits'.
AD_GossipAboutHiding_1.context: NodeContext: Nodding - she knows he's lying, but isn't going to call him on it. Tries a different tack

AD_GossipAboutHiding_12.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutHiding_12.text: You don't need to watch the door, you know. No one's getting in that we don't want to.
AD_GossipAboutHiding_12.context: NodeContext: She knows the boy is watching the door out of fear of intruders

AD_GossipAboutHiding_4.speaker: Tate
AD_GossipAboutHiding_4.text: They don't need to get past the door. They could just b-board it up and burn the place.
AD_GossipAboutHiding_4.context: NodeContext: Blank, remembering what happened to his own family

AD_GossipAboutHiding_9.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutHiding_9.text: True, I suppose. But you have something out there that you didn't, in your last house.
AD_GossipAboutHiding_9.context: NodeContext: Not denying it or lying to comfort the boy - but assuring him he's protected

AD_GossipAboutHiding_2.speaker: Tate
AD_GossipAboutHiding_2.context: NodeContext: Realizing - Fig is the youngest child playing outside with a sword. She fancies herself a warrior.

AD_GossipAboutHiding_15.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutHiding_15.text: Would you like a book? I can have Jhessem drop one up. Maybe she'll even read it with you.

AD_GossipAboutHiding_7.speaker: Tate
AD_GossipAboutHiding_7.text: Jhess...? Eh, no. That's all right. I'm all right.
AD_GossipAboutHiding_7.context: NodeContext: A little nervous and shy

AD_GossipAboutHiding_3.speaker: Rion
AD_GossipAboutHiding_3.text: What if I tell her not to do the goblin voice?
AD_GossipAboutHiding_3.context: NodeContext: Smiling - she knows exactly why he doesn't want the theatrical younger sister reading to him.

AD_GossipAboutHiding_6.speaker: Tate
AD_GossipAboutHiding_6.text: I guess... that would be okay.

MessengerRat002_1.speaker: Messenger Rat
MessengerRat002_1.text: There's been killings in a holy place! Stinks of incense and blood.

MessengerRat002_2.speaker: Messenger Rat
MessengerRat002_2.text: I did not nibble at the body. No matter how much I wanted to.

JaheiraSawFamilyAttacked_4.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraSawFamilyAttacked_4.text: You... you did something to me. I will not have my strings pulled like some parasite's puppet. You will not get the chance to do it again.

JaheiraSawFamilyAttacked_3.speaker: Minsc
JaheiraSawFamilyAttacked_3.text: Boo can stand the stench of your foul deeds no longer. We go in search of more fragrant heroes.

JaheiraSawFamilyAttacked_5.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraSawFamilyAttacked_5.text: You brought violence into my home. Know that I only leave you alive to fulfil your purpose against the Absolute - I make no promises for when all of this is done.

PAD_JaheiraAttackedFamily_2.speaker: Jaheira
PAD_JaheiraAttackedFamily_2.text: What - what am I doing? Some tadpole trickery...? I won't stand around and be manipulated.

AD_Attacked_MiddleDaughter_0.speaker: Jhessem
AD_Attacked_MiddleDaughter_0.context: NodeContext: Your home has been attacked, you're shouting at your younger siblings to run like you've been told. 'Rye-on'

AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_0.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_0.text: Shutters secured, sanctuary sealed. All I can do for now.

AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_1.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_1.text: I'll leave out some oats for that badger. Might improve it's bloody mood if it comes back.

AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_2.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_2.text: Tending the house, I can handle. Plants - you're on your own.
AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_2.context: NodeContext: Washing his hands of keeping the plants alive.

AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_3.speaker: 21783519-4c61-4e36-abd4-c9386303cade
AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_3.text: Don't worry, High Harper. This place will still be here if Rion comes back. When.
AD_HalflingSquatterIdles_3.context: NodeContext: Musing - catching himself doubting and doubling down on the 'when'
